=Data=

The WiGi application allow you to visualize graphs saved as .dnv files. A folder called 'graphs' contains three examples of graphs for the application is available at the following address : http://code.google.com/p/wigis/downloads/detail?name=graphs.zip&can=2&q=#makechanges.

This page explains how a graph is stored into a .dnv file. The example below presents you a basic graph composed of two nodes linked by one edge. The aim of this example is to explain you how you can modify graphs or create your own datasets.
{{{
<DNVGRAPH>
	<Level value="0" numberOfNodes="2" numberOfEdges="1">
		<DNVNODE Id="1" Level="0" Position="[82.33818 , 55.25211]" Color="[0.84166664 , 0.73333335 , 1.0]" Size="1.0" Label="" Mass="1.0" Fixed="false" Icon="" Type="" BBid="" ForceLabel="false" Alpha="1.0" LabelColor="null" LabelOutlineColor="null" OutlineColor="null" LabelSize="null" Expandable="false" HideLabelBackground="false" CurvedLabel="false" Visible="true" Selected="false">
		</DNVNODE>
		<DNVNODE Id="2" Level="0" Position="[53.328995 , 6.9600196]" Color="[0.84166664 , 0.73333335 , 1.0]" Size="1.0" Label="" Mass="1.0" Fixed="false" Icon="" Type="" BBid="" ForceLabel="false" Alpha="1.0" LabelColor="null" LabelOutlineColor="null" OutlineColor="null" LabelSize="null" Expandable="false" HideLabelBackground="false" CurvedLabel="false" Visible="true" Selected="false">
		</DNVNODE>
		<DNVEDGE Id="3" Level="0" Length="10.0" K="0.3" From="1" To="2" Label="" Directional="false" BBid="" Color="[-1.0 , -1.0 , -1.0]" Type="" HasSetColor="true" Alpha="1.0" LabelColor="null" LabelOutlineColor="null" LabelSize="null" Thickness="1.0" Visible="true">
		</DNVEDGE>
	</Level>
</DNVGRAPH>
}}}

The code is simple to understand and works like an xml file by using tags. There is three different types of tags :
  * <DNVGRAPH></DNVGRAPH> : everything between these two tags can be either a node or an edge.
  * <DNVNODE></DNVNODE> : this tag is used to create a new node by giving him several informations such as an 'id', a 'label', a 'size', etc...
  * <DNVEDGE></DNVEDGE> : this tag is used to create a new edge, connecting two nodes together

_Be careful with the ids, each object (either node or edge) has its own id so don't restart from 0 or 1 when you create the edges._
